intro: Arabis tschuktschorum, commonly known as Tschuktschorum rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of pale green, fleshy leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in early spring. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
